meanings.definition: To set or place heavily or abruptly
meanings.sent1: She was plonking the books on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: He plonked the cup on the table.
meanings.sent3: The cat was plonking its toy around the room.
meanings.sent4: The rain was plonking on the roof all night.
meanings.sent5: The chef was plonking ingredients into the pot with a loud noise.

meanings.definition: The sound of something heavy or solid falling with a thud
meanings.sent1: The plonking of the hammer echoed in the room.
meanings.sent2: We heard the plonking of the box hitting the floor.
meanings.sent3: The plonking of the watermelon made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The plonking of the rock into the pond created ripples.
meanings.sent5: The plonking of the book falling off the shelf startled us.
